content: not your ordinary market bag most mesh market bags are crocheted in the round and will stretch lengthwise when you put things in them often getting narrower in diameter at the top as well this bag is crocheted as a square mesh which is then gathered at the opposite sides to form the front/back and left/right sides the result is a bag that mostly stretches in width diameter and much less in length no more bag stretching to your knees when you put something in it crocheted with thread it is lightweight and easily portable size empty & unstretched 13 x 16 not including handles approximately the bag is very stretchy suggested materials  #10 thread variegated or self-striping recommended  size 7 steel hook 1 75 or 1 80  6-7 feet of cord see handles section for details  stitch markers  large-eye needle for closing up the handles and weaving in ends abbreviations used  st = stitch  slip_stitch = slip_stitch does not count as a stitch  chain = chain stitch  single_crochet = single_crochet stitch  double_crochet = double_crochet stitch  space = space  skip = skip gauge  gauge is not important but for the bag shown and the dimensions given gauge was 9 chain = 1 inch pattern body of bag you will create a square mesh approximately 25 on each side unstretched r1 base chain chain 346 turn r2 single_crochet in 15th chain from hook single_crochet in next chain *chain 9 skip 9 chs single_crochet in next 2 chs* repeat *-* a total of 29 times your last 2 single_crochet should be in the first 2 chs of the base chain see photo 1 if you are off by 1 or 2 chs just double_crochet in the last 2 chs of base chain and keep going you should have made 30 loops chain 5 turn see photo 2 30 sps © marsha glassner 2018 r3 being careful to work into r2 and not the base chain *chain 9 2 single_crochet in next chain-space* repeat *-* a total of 30 times in the first repeat you will single_crochet into the chain-9 loop you most recently completed see photo 3 on the last repeat you will work into the 14 chain loop which consists of the 5 loops from the end of r1 plus the beginning 9 chs of r2 see photo 4 these two scs should be approximately at the 5th chain 1/3 of the loop chain 5 turn you should have 30 loops r4 *chain 9 2 single_crochet in next chain-space* repeat *-* a total of 30 times in the first repeat you will single_crochet into the chain-9 loop you most recently completed see photo 5 on the last repeat you will work into the 14 chain loop which consists of the 5 loops from the end of r2 plus the beginning 9 chs of r3 see photo 6 r5 r73 repeat r4 omitting the final chain-5 at the end
